DataElement.preferredDefinition: Terminology for the anticipated outcome that is the purpose for the administration of concomitant medication(s).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Concomitant Medication Domain Therapeutic Procedure Intent
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to concomitant medication administration._An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process._An anticipated outcome that is the purpose for actions taken, thus guiding the action.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to concomitant medication administration.

Concepts.definition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to concomitant medication administration.

Property.preferredDefinition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.:Intent; an anticipated outcome that is intended or that guides your planned actions.

Concepts.definition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.
An anticipated outcome that is the purpose for actions taken, thus guiding the action.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Concomitant Medication per CDISC CM Definition

ValueDomain.preferredName: Concomitant Medication Domain Therapeutic Procedure Intent Category
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to concomitant medication administration._An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process._An anticipated outcome that is the purpose for actions taken, thus guiding the action._A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Concept annotation added for UPitt/TCGA.  Ylu, 02/03/2015.
ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2023.3.7 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0002119. ak

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Serving or tending to restore health; a remedy.

Concepts.definition: Serving or tending to restore health; a remedy.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any action or response, without curative intent, that mitigates some or all of the unpleasant effects of a disease or condition.

Concepts.definition: Any action or response, without curative intent, that mitigates some or all of the unpleasant effects of a disease or condition.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Treatment that is given after the cancer has not responded to other treatments.

Concepts.definition: Performing a salvage procedure is the last resort. The clinical situation involves either ongoing life support measures, life support measures for more than 60 seconds during the prior 10 minutes, or unanticipated institution of extracorporeal circulatory support. (ACC)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Treatment that is given after initial therapy to kill any remaining cancer cells.

Concepts.definition: Treatment that is given after initial therapy to kill any remaining cancer cells.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Continuation of treatment for an extended period of time to prevent relapse.

Concepts.definition: Continuation of treatment for an extended period of time to prevent relapse.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The first choice of treatment for a particular type of cancer.

Concepts.definition: The first choice of treatment for a particular type of cancer.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any therapy that is administered to augment or stimulate other treatment modalities or to minimize or prevent disease recurrence subsequent to the main treatment plan.: The administration of therapeutic agents prior to the primary treatment for the purpose of making the primary treatment more effective.

Concepts.definition: Any therapy that is administered to augment or stimulate other treatment modalities or to minimize or prevent disease recurrence subsequent to the main treatment plan.
Therapy administered prior to the primary treatment for the purpose of making the primary treatment more effective.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to concomitant medication administration.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.:An anticipated outcome that is the purpose for actions taken, thus guiding the action.:A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

Concepts.definition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to concomitant medication administration.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.
An anticipated outcome that is the purpose for actions taken, thus guiding the action.
A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.
